bug.author: dynamicwebpaige
bug.summary: Feature: End-to-end TensorFlow Extended (TFX) example for TF 2.0.
bug.description:
is an end-to-end, TensorFlow-based, general-purpose machine learning platform implemented at Google. We've already open sourced some TFX libraries with the rest of the system to come. For an overview of TFX, read our <denchmark-link:https://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=3098021>KDDâ€™2017 paper</denchmark-link> and watch the <denchmark-link:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vdG7uKQ2eKk>Dev Summit talk</denchmark-link> . TFX includes:
TensorFlow Data Validation: a library for exploring and validating machine learning data. TensorFlow Transform: full-pass analyses over data to create transformation graphs that are consistently applied during training and serving. TensorFlow Model Analysis: libraries and visualization components to compute full-pass and sliced model metrics over large datasets, and analyze them in a notebook. TensorFlow Serving: a flexible, high-performance serving system for machine learning models, designed for production environments.
The purpose of this issue is to track the creation of an end-to-end TFX example using TensorFlow 2.0: a Keras model working with Transform, TFMA, data validation, and Serving.

comments.comment: Nice intro at GoogleNext19 but will a full demo be available soon?
how it is done in the project tracker and still open in github? it is a bit confusing to track the progress. and please if it is done, how can we access this example?

here is a link to the end-to-end example using the Chicago taxi dataset - <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tfx/tree/master/tfx/examples/chicago_taxi_pipeline>https://github.com/tensorflow/tfx/tree/master/tfx/examples/chicago_taxi_pipeline</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/shubham-samant>@shubham-samant</denchmark-link> this link is sending me to the old example, still in TF 1.X. Do you have a reference for an example using TF 2.0 and TFX?

as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ahmedanis03>@ahmedanis03</denchmark-link> mentioned, it is a bit confusing that this is open here but the task is marked as done. Is there already material or is it under development?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/dynamicwebpaige>@dynamicwebpaige</denchmark-link> , are we to interpret <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tfx/issues/542>tensorflow/tfx#542</denchmark-link> and the current status of "Done" here to mean that this will not be a part of the TF 2.0 release?

I wonder if there are any news regarding that, and specifically regarding TF Transform together with the new Tensorflow 2.0. The functionality in TFT is quite important to produce well-structured preprocessing steps without leaking info between train and validation/test set. On the other hand, anyone who know about a nice approach to replace TFT for the while? Thanks

anyone who know about a nice approach to replace TFT for the while
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Efaq>@Efaq</denchmark-link> i might be able to help but first, could you please clarify what you meant by the following statement and what is the failure condition under which this is expected?
without leaking info between train and validation/test set
Thanks..
Closing old issue, we have several e2e examples now.
